cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 125 miles SE of Cape Canaveral, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest parallel to the Florida east coast, then curving north-northwest toward the coasts of Georgia and South Carolina
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: brushes the Florida east-central coast near Cape Canaveral (closest coastal encounter rather than an inland landfall)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Englewood to Anclote River (Gulf side of Florida)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Ocean Reef to south of Boca Raton (TS Wng); Boca Raton to South Santee River SC (Hurr Wng)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida east coast from Ocean Reef northward, Georgia and South Carolina coasts
weather_observation.wind: Strong tropical-storm-force winds with the potential for hurricane-force gusts (50–70 mph) during Friday morning
weather_observation.storm_surge: Surge 4–6 ft possible for Boca Raton–Sebastian Inlet, including Port Everglades, if peak surge coincides with high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: 6–12 inches of rain possible along the immediate Florida east coast with isolated amounts near 15 inches
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and life-threatening rip currents; isolated tornadoes possible in outer rainbands
